intro: Veronica panormitana subsp. baradostensis, commonly known as the Baradost speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It has slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
